Plot Server¶

The dash app¶

Dictionary containing the layout options for the plotly plots.

plot_dash_client_copy.LEGEND: dict = {'bgcolor': 'rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.63)', 'x': 0.01, 'xanchor': 'left', 'y': 0.99, 'yanchor': 'top'}¶

Dictionary describing the formattting of the legend in the plotly plots.

plot_dash_client_copy.addOrUpdateTrace(fig_2: Figure, new_pass_no: int, pass_name: str, new_x: float, new_y: float) → Patch[source]¶

Method called to add or update the traces in a plotly Figure.

Parameters:
fig_2plotly.graph_objects.Figure

The plotly Figure object in which traces are to be added or updated.

new_pass_noint

Integer indicating the new pass no of the measurement point.

pass_namestr

String with the name of the trace to be added or updated.

new_xfloat

x coordinate of the point to be added or updated to the trace.

new_yfloat

y coordinate of the point to be added or updated to the trace.

Returns:
dash.Patch

The patch to the plotly Figure object.

 16import gevent

 18from shared_memory_dict import SharedMemoryDict

 20load_figure_template(["bootstrap"])
 21
 22BOOTSTRAP = pio.templates["bootstrap"]
 23"""Bootstrap theme for the plotly figure."""
 24
 25CONFIG: dict = {
 26    "scrollZoom": True,
 27    "displaylogo": False,
 28    "toImageButtonOptions": {
 29        "format": "svg",
 30        "filename": "custom_image",
 31        "scale": 1,
 32    },
 33    "modeBarButtonsToRemove": ["select2d", "lasso2d"],
 34}
 35"""Dictionary containing configuration options for the plotly plots."""
 36
 37LAYOUT: dict = {
 38    "autosize": True,
 39    "template": BOOTSTRAP,
 40    "margin": {
 41        "l": 80,
 42        "r": 5,
 43        "b": 40,
 44        "t": 5,
 45        "pad": 5,
 46    },
 47    "dragmode": "pan",
 48    "font_size": 11,
 49    "hovermode": "closest",
 50    "modebar": {"orientation": "v"},
 51}
 52"""Dictionary containing the layout options for the plotly plots."""
 53
 54LEGEND: dict = {
 55    "yanchor": "top",
 56    "y": 0.99,
 57    "xanchor": "left",
 58    "x": 0.01,
 59    "bgcolor": "rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.63)",
 60}
 61"""Dictionary describing the formattting of the legend in the plotly plots."""
 62
 63
 64def reset_fig(batch_mode: bool = False) -> go.Figure:
 65    """Method to create a blank plotly Figure with the required template.
 66
 67    Parameters
 68    ----------
 69    batch_mode : bool, optional
 70        Booleann indicating if the measurement is a batch mode one, by default False
 71
 72    Returns
 73    -------
 74    plotly.graph_objects.Figure
 75        The plotly Figure object that is created.
 76    """
 77    trace_name = "pass_1"
 78    if batch_mode:
 79        trace_name = "b1_pass_1"
 80    fig = go.Figure(
 81        data=[go.Scatter(x=[], y=[], mode="markers+lines", line_width=1, marker_size=4, name=trace_name)],
 82        layout=go.Layout(
 83            **LAYOUT,
 84            xaxis_title="Binding Energy [eV]",
 85            yaxis_title="Counts",
 86            uirevision="no_change",
 87            legend={
 88                "orientation": "h",
 89                "xanchor": "center",
 90                "x": 0.5,
 91            },
 92        ),
 93    )
 94
 95    fig = addPlotRefLines(fig)
 96
 97    return fig
 98
 99
100def addPlotRefLines(fig: go.Figure) -> go.Figure:
101    """Method to add reference photoelectron spectral lines to the plot figure.
102
103    Parameters
104    ----------
105    fig : plotly.graph_objects.Figure
106        The plotly Figure object on which the reference lines are to be added.
107
108    Returns
109    -------
110    plotly.graph_objects.Figure
111        The plotly Figure in which the reference lines are added.
112    """
113    fig.add_vline(
114        x=83.95,
115        line=dict(
116            color="#B3DF72",
117            width=3,
118            dash="dash",
119        ),
120        opacity=0.6,
121        name=r"$\large \text{Au 4f}_\text{7/2}$",
122        showlegend=True,
123    )
124    fig.add_vline(
125        x=87.9,
126        line=dict(
127            color="#FD9891",
128            width=3,
129            dash="dash",
130        ),
131        opacity=0.6,
132        name=r"$\large \text{Au 4f}_\text{5/2}$",
133        showlegend=True,
134    )
135    fig.add_vline(
136        x=284.4,
137        line=dict(
138            color="#FEC195",
139            width=3,
140            dash="dash",
141        ),
142        opacity=0.6,
143        name=r"$\large \text{C 1s}$",
144        showlegend=True,
145    )
146    fig.add_vline(
147        x=72.84,
148        line=dict(
149            color="#F5CD47",
150            width=3,
151            dash="dash",
152        ),
153        opacity=0.6,
154        name=r"$\large \text{Al 2p}_\text{3/2}$",
155        showlegend=True,
156    )
157    fig.add_vline(
158        x=532.70,
159        line=dict(
160            color="#7EE2B8",
161            width=3,
162            dash="dash",
163        ),
164        opacity=0.6,
165        name=r"$\large \text{O 1s}$",
166        showlegend=True,
167    )
168    fig.add_vline(
169        x=118,
170        line=dict(
171            color="#9DD9EE",
172            width=3,
173            dash="dash",
174        ),
175        opacity=0.6,
176        name=r"$\large \text{Al 2s}$",
177        showlegend=True,
178    )
179
180    return fig
181
182
183share_mem_plot_data = SharedMemoryDict(name="plotdata", size=3000)
184"""Shared memory buffer where the plot data is saved by the main program."""
185
186app = Dash(__name__)
187"""The main Dash app."""
188
189# Initialize figure and trace outside the callback function
190fig = reset_fig()
191"""Figure variable for the plot area of the dash app."""
192
193app.layout = html.Div(
194    [
195        dcc.Graph(
196            id="live-update-graph",
197            figure=fig,
198            config=CONFIG,
199            style={
200                "height": "97vh",
201                "width": "97vw",
202            },
203            mathjax=True,
204        ),
205        dcc.Interval(
206            id="interval-component",
207            interval=1 * 500,  # in milliseconds
208            n_intervals=0,
209        ),
210        dcc.Store(id="iteration-no", data=0),
211    ],
212    style={"height": "97vh", "width": "97vw"},
213)
214
215# Production server setup
216http_server = WSGIServer(("", 8050), app.server)
217"""The WSGI production server to serve the Dash app with the plot."""
218
219
220@callback(
221    Output("live-update-graph", "figure"),
222    Output("iteration-no", "data"),
223    Input("interval-component", "n_intervals"),
224    State("live-update-graph", "figure"),
225    State("iteration-no", "data"),
226)
227def update_graph_live(n: int, ex_fig: dict, local_iter: int) -> tuple[Patch | dash._callback.NoUpdate, int]:
228    """Method that is called in periodic intervals.
229
230    Parameters
231    ----------
232    n : int
233        The number of intervals. Not used.
234    ex_fig : dict
235        The plotly Figure from the dash plot server.
236
237    Returns
238    -------
239    dash.Patch | dash._callback.NoUpdate
240        The Patch to the plotly Figure of the Dash server. no_update incase an Exception is raised or a measurement is cancelled.
241    """
242    fig_2 = go.Figure(ex_fig)
243    patched_figure = Patch()
244
245    try:
246        # fig_2 = go.Figure(ex_fig_data, ex_fig_layout)
247
248        running_status = share_mem_plot_data["run_status"]
249        data_packet = share_mem_plot_data["fig"]
250        cancel_status = share_mem_plot_data["cancelled"]
251        batch_data = share_mem_plot_data["batch_details"]
252
253        set_props("interval-component", props={"interval": int(0.5*share_mem_plot_data["interval"]*1000)})
254
255
256        global_iter = share_mem_plot_data["iteration"]
257        # data_packet = {
258        #         "Binding Energy [eV]": [],
259        #         "Pass No.": 1,
260        #         "Time_per_step [s]": [],
261        #         "Counts": [],
262        #         "Counts_per_milli [/ms]": [],
263        #         "U6_DAC0_Voltage [V]": [],
264        #         "MAX5216_DAC_Voltage [V]": [],
265        #     }
266
267        new_x = data_packet["Binding Energy [eV]"]
268        new_y = data_packet["Counts"]
269        new_pass_no = data_packet["Pass No."]
270
271        if running_status:
272            if local_iter < global_iter:
273                if not batch_data["batch_type"]:
274                    return addOrUpdateTrace(fig_2, new_pass_no, f"pass_{int(new_pass_no)}", new_x, new_y), global_iter
275                else:
276                    return addOrUpdateTrace(
277                        fig_2, batch_data["batch_pass_no"], f"b{batch_data['batch_no']}_pass_{new_pass_no}", new_x, new_y
278                    ), global_iter
279            elif global_iter==1:
280                return no_update, 0
281            else:
282                return no_update, local_iter
283        else:
284            if not cancel_status:
285                return no_update, 0
286
287            fig_2 = reset_fig()
288
289            patched_figure["data"] = fig_2.to_dict()["data"]
290
291            return patched_figure, 0
292    except Exception as e:
293        print(e)
294        return no_update, local_iter
295
296
297def addOrUpdateTrace(fig_2: go.Figure, new_pass_no: int, pass_name: str, new_x: float, new_y: float) -> Patch:
298    """Method called to add or update the traces in a plotly Figure.
299
300    Parameters
301    ----------
302    fig_2 : plotly.graph_objects.Figure
303        The plotly Figure object in which traces are to be added or updated.
304    new_pass_no : int
305        Integer indicating the new pass no of the measurement point.
306    pass_name : str
307        String with the name of the trace to be added or updated.
308    new_x : float
309        x coordinate of the point to be added or updated to the trace.
310    new_y : float
311        y coordinate of the point to be added or updated to the trace.
312
313    Returns
314    -------
315    dash.Patch
316        The patch to the plotly Figure object.
317    """
318    existing_passes = len(fig_2["data"])
319    patched_figure = Patch()
320    if existing_passes < new_pass_no:
321        fig_2.add_trace(
322            go.Scatter(
323                x=[new_x],
324                y=[new_y],
325                mode="markers+lines",
326                line_width=1,
327                marker_size=4,
328                name=pass_name,
329            )
330        )
331        patched_figure["data"] = fig_2.to_dict()["data"]
332        return patched_figure
333
334    patched_figure["data"][existing_passes - 1]["x"].append(new_x)
335    patched_figure["data"][existing_passes - 1]["y"].append(new_y)
336
337    return patched_figure
338
339
340def term_handler() -> None:
341    r"""Method to terminate the server after receiving a SIGTERM signal."""
342    print("Received SIGTERM - Gracefully shutting down...")
343    share_mem_plot_data.shm.close()
344    share_mem_plot_data.shm.unlink()
345    http_server.stop()
346
347
348if __name__ == "__main__":
349    # app.run(debug=True)
350
351    gevent.signal_handler(signal.SIGTERM, term_handler)
352    http_server.serve_forever()
